intro: Sutera affinis, commonly known as the silverleaf suture plant, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its silver-gray leaves and bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually pale blue to white, and it blooms in the summer months. Sutera affinis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
